briefTitle: Senior PharmAssist: Co-Design and Evaluation of a Toolkit to Promote Scalable Implementation
officialTitle: Senior PharmAssist: Co-Design and Evaluation of a Toolkit to Promote Scalable Implementation

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 60 or older
* Currently or soon to be enrolled in Medicare
* Income is at or below 200% of Poverty Line
* Lives in one of 3 targeted communities learning to implement the Senior PharmAssist\^TM core services
* Seeks assistance with medications, Medicare counseling, or tailored referrals from agencies participating in Senior PharmAssist\^TM learning collaborative

Exclusion Criteria:

None

primary.measure: Number of Older Adults Seeking Service Who Received All 4 Components of Senior PharmAssist Intervention

secondary.measure: Percentage of Older Adults Receiving Medication Therapy Management
Percentage of Older Adults Receiving Medication Co-pay Assistance
Percentage of Older Adults Receiving at Least One Tailored Community Referral
Percentage of Older Adults Receiving Medicare Counseling

other.description:
Change from baseline in proportion of participants who rate their health as good to excellent.

Scale of rating ranges from 1 = poor, 2 = fair, 3 = good, 4 = very good, 5 = excellent.
other.timeFrame: Baseline, 13 months post-completion of learning collaborative
